matter.summary: Jane Smith suffered cervical and lumbar injuries when a Central Logistics delivery truck rear-ended her vehicle at a red light on March 14, 2024. She continues to experience chronic pain that interferes with her work as a dental hygienist.

documents.title: Police Collision Report
documents.summary: Officer Hernandez recorded that the Central Logistics driver failed to stop at a red light and struck Ms. Smith's vehicle at approximately 35 mph. Witness statements confirm Ms. Smith had the right of way.
facts: Defendant admitted to looking at dispatch tablet at time of impact.
Weather and road conditions were clear.

documents.title: Medical Treatment Summary
documents.summary: Dr. Patel documented cervical strain and lumbar sprain with radiculopathy. Treatment included imaging, medication, and physical therapy. Prognosis notes continuing pain and recommendation for future follow-up.
facts: MRI shows C5-C6 disc protrusion causing nerve impingement.
Therapist notes ongoing pain level of 6/10 affecting work duties.

documents.title: Lost Wages Calculation
documents.summary: Spreadsheet showing four weeks of lost wages and projected reduced hours for three months.
facts: Projected reduced hours cause an additional $6,400 loss.

events.description: Rear-end collision at Mission & 5th in San Francisco.
Initial consultation and treatment plan with Dr. Patel.
Employer provided letter confirming reduced work hours.

issues.issue: Negligence under Cal. Civ. Code ยง 1714
facts: Driver failed to maintain proper lookout and stop at red light.
Ongoing pain management anticipated for 12 months.

authorities.summary: Establishes general duty of care for motorists.
Jury instruction outlining elements of negligence.
Jury instruction for past and future medical expenses.

strengths: Clear liability documented by police and witness statements.
weaknesses: Client had prior chiropractic treatment two years before incident.
concessions: Open to structured settlement with partial upfront payment.
evidentiary_gaps: Pending updated radiology report from June 2024 scan.
